definition: marked by eager hopefulness : confidently optimistic
examples: In the month of August 1994, Democrats remained sanguine about their chances at the polls …
A lot of attention also is being devoted to the development of vaccines to prevent genital herpes, although not everyone is sanguine about the outcome.
— The Journal of the American Medical Association
… the radiant heat from the cedar logs, whose sanguine colour made the silvered locks of his hair into a fantastic wreath of flames.

definition: consisting of or relating to blood
examples: … some sanguine vessels are obstructed, and distended …
… attacked by the sanguine … warriors of neighboring islands …

definition: accompanied by, involving, or relating to bloodshed : bloody
examples: … from the numerous graves, including those by the barn, which our shells had destroyed; we realized what a sanguine battle it had been …
She was all unnerved; her naturally sanguine complexion was pale …

definition: having blood as the predominating bodily humor — see humor entry 1 sense 2c, having the bodily conformation and temperament held characteristic of such predominance and marked by sturdiness, healthy red complexion, and cheerfulness
examples: An abundance of red blood was marked by a warm and sanguine temperament; whereas, an excess of yellow bile produced the choleric temperament …
He conceived himself rather as a sanguine and strenuous man, a great fighter.
